required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Technology Interventions to Improve Outcomes After Knee Replacement
clinical_study.official_title: Reducing Sedentary Time Using an Innovative mHealth Intervention Among Total Knee Replacement Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine the effects of two technology interventions on health outcomes (e.g., physical activity, sedentary behavior, physical function, pain) after knee replacement at 2 and 5 months .

detailed_description.textblock: Two 8 week technology interventions will be examined and consist of the use of an app and/or website and regular calls. Assessments to examine outcomes will be completed at baseline, as well as at 2 and 5 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Objectively Measured (Actigraph) Sedentary Behavior at 2 months
primary_outcome.description: change sedentary behavior (<100 counts/minute) measured with Actigraph accelerometers between baseline and 3 months

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Objectively Measured (Actigraph) Sedentary Behavior at 5 months
primary_outcome.description: change in sedentary behavior (<100 counts/minute) measured with Actigraph accelerometers between baseline and 6 months

secondary_outcome.description: WOMAC Pain Subscale - Scores range from 0 (no pain) to 20 (maximal pain)

secondary_outcome.measure: Total physical activity measured by Actigraph accelerometers
secondary_outcome.description: objectively measured light, moderate and vigorous activity (>= 100 counts/min) by Actigraph accelerometers
total days NEAT! app was used
percentage of notifications in which a transition from sitting to standing was detected

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in physical function via chair stand test

other_outcome.measure: Change in physical function via timed up and go
Change in Knee Symptoms - KOOS pain
other_outcome.description: KOOS pain subcale (0 indicates extreme problems, 100 no problems)

other_outcome.measure: Change in Knee Symptoms - KOOS symptoms
other_outcome.description: KOOS symptoms subcale (0 indicates extreme problems, 100 no problems)

other_outcome.measure: Change in Knee Symptoms - KOOS ADL
other_outcome.description: KOOS ADL subcale (0 indicates extreme problems, 100 no problems)

other_outcome.measure: Change in Knee Symptoms - KOOS sport/rec
other_outcome.description: KOOS sport/rec subcale (0 indicates extreme problems, 100 no problems)

other_outcome.measure: Change in Knee Symptoms - KOOS QoL
other_outcome.description: KOOS QOL subcales (0 indicates extreme problems, 100 no problems)

other_outcome.measure: Change in knee symptoms via WOMAC
other_outcome.description: WOMAC total score (pain, stiffness, and function) - Scores range from 0 (no problems) to 96 (extreme problems)

other_outcome.measure: Change in sedentary time via activPAL accelerometers

other_outcome.description: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - T score of 50 represents average for general population (scores higher than 50 represent better function and mobility)

other_outcome.measure: Patient Reported outcomes - global health - T-Score
other_outcome.description: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Global Health - T score of 50 represents average for general population (scores higher than 50 represent better health)

other_outcome.measure: Patient Reported outcomes - sleep disturbance - T-Score
other_outcome.description: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Sleep disturbance - T score of 50 represents average for general population (scores higher than 50 represent worse sleep disturbance)

other_outcome.measure: Change in sedentary time via SIT-Q

arm_group.description: Participants randomized to this arm will use the NEAT!2 app and receive biweekly coaching calls for 8 weeks, and monthly maintenance calls between months 2-5.
Participants randomized to this arm will use the MyKneeGuide app/website and receive biweekly coaching calls for 8 weeks, and monthly maintenance calls between months 2-5.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Be 40-79 years of age
- Had unilateral knee replacement within last 12 months
- Have an Android or iOS smartphone that is accessible and near them the majority of the day
- Be willing to download the study applications on their smartphone
- Spend at least 7 hours/day sitting
- Be English speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have any contraindications to activity
- Have a mobility limiting comorbidity
- Have a scheduled surgery within the next 6 months
- Do not have ≥4 days of valid accelerometer (>=10 hours) wear at baseline.

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified study data will be made available 12 months after the primary manuscript is published.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: 12 months after primary manuscripts are published
